verses.verse: And <WG2532> there are gathered together<WG4863> unto<WG4314> him<WG846> the Pharisees<WG5330>, and<WG2532> certain<WG5100> of the scribes<WG1122>, who had come<WG2064> from<WG575> Jerusalem<WG2414>,

and <WG2532> had seen<WG1492> that<WG5124> some<WG5100> of<WG3101> his<WG846> disciples<WG3101> ate<WG2068> their bread<WG740> with<WG5495> defiled<WG2839>, that<WG5124> is<WG2076>, unwashen<WG449>, hands<WG5495>.

(For <WG1063> the Pharisees<WG5330>, and<WG2532> all<WG3956> the Jews<WG2453>, except<WG1437> they wash<WG3538> their hands<WG5495> diligently<WG4435>, eat<WG2068> not<WG3756>, holding<WG2902> the tradition<WG3862> of the elders<WG4245>;

and <WG2532> when they come from<WG575> the marketplace<WG58>, except3362, 3361 they bathe<WG907> themselves<WG2068>, they eat not<WG3756>; and<WG2532> many<WG4183> other things<WG243> there are<WG2076>, which<WG3739> they have received<WG3880> to hold<WG2902>, washings<WG909> of cups<WG4221>, and<WG2532> pots<WG3582>, and<WG2532> brasen vessels<WG5473>.)

And <WG2532> the Pharisees<WG5330> and<WG2532> the scribes<WG1122> ask<WG1905> him<WG1223>, Why<WG5101> walk<WG4043> not<WG3756> thy<WG4675> disciples<WG3101> according to<WG2596> the tradition<WG3862> of the elders<WG4245>, but<WG235> eat<WG2068> their bread<WG740> with<WG5495> defiled<WG449> hands<WG5495>?

And <WG1161> he<WG611> said<WG2036> unto them<WG3754>, Well<WG2573> did<WG4395> Isaiah<WG2268> prophesy<WG4395> of<WG4012> you<WG5216> hypocrites<WG5273>, as<WG5613> it is written<WG1125>, This<WG3778> people<WG2992> honoreth<WG5091> me<WG3165> with<WG5491> their lips<WG5491>, But<WG1161> their<WG846> heart<WG2588> is<WG568> far<WG4206> from<WG575> me<WG1700>.
But <WG1161> in vain<WG3155> do they worship<WG4576> me<WG3165>, Teaching<WG1321> as their doctrines<WG1319> the precepts<WG1778> of men<WG444>.
Ye <WG1063> leave<WG863> the commandment<WG1785> of God<WG2316>, and<WG2532> hold<WG2902> fast the tradition<WG3862> of men<WG444>.
And <WG2532> he said<WG3004> unto them<WG846>, Full well<WG2573> do ye reject<WG114> the commandment<WG1785> of God<WG2316>, that<WG2443> ye may keep<WG5083> your<WG5216> tradition<WG3862>.

For <WG1063> Moses<WG3475> said<WG2036>, Honor<WG5091> thy<WG4675> father<WG3962> and<WG2532> thy<WG4675> mother<WG3384>; and<WG2532>, He that speaketh evil<WG2551> of father<WG3962> or<WG2228> mother<WG3384>, let him die<WG5053> the death<WG2288>:

but <WG1161> ye<WG5210> say<WG3004>, If<WG1437> a man<WG444> shall say<WG2036> to his father<WG3962> or<WG2228> his mother<WG3384>, That<WG3739> wherewith<WG1437> thou mightest have been profited<WG5623> by<WG3739> me<WG1700> is Corban<WG2878>, that<WG3739> is to say<WG2076>, Given to God<WG1435>;
ye <WG2532> no longer<WG3765> suffer<WG863> him<WG846> to do<WG4160> aught<WG3762> for<WG3962> his<WG846> father<WG3962> or<WG2228> his<WG846> mother<WG3384>;

making <WG208> void<WG208> the word<WG3056> of God<WG2316> by your<WG5216> tradition<WG3862>, which<WG3739> ye have delivered<WG3860>: and<WG2532> many<WG4183> such<WG5108> like things<WG3946> ye do<WG4160>.
And <WG2532> he called<WG4341> to him the<WG3956> multitude<WG3793> again<WG3004>, and said unto them<WG846>, Hear<WG191> me<WG3450> all<WG3956> of you<WG2532>, and understand<WG4920>:

there is<WG2076> nothing<WG3762> from without<WG1855> the man<WG444>, that<WG3739> going<WG1531> into<WG1519> him<WG846> can<WG1410> defile<WG2840> him<WG846>; but<WG235> the things which proceed out<WG1607> of<WG575> the man<WG846> are those<WG1565> that<WG2076> defile<WG2840> the man<WG444>.

And <WG2532> when<WG3753> he was entered<WG1525> into<WG1519> the house<WG3624> from<WG575> the multitude<WG3793>, his<WG846> disciples<WG3101> asked<WG1905> of him<WG846> the<WG4012> parable<WG3850>.

And <WG2532> he saith<WG3004> unto them<WG846>, Are<WG2075> ye<WG5210> so<WG3779> without understanding<WG801> also<WG2532>? Perceive<WG3539> ye<WG3539> not<WG3756>, that<WG3754> whatsoever<WG3956> from without<WG1855> goeth<WG1531> into<WG1519> the man<WG444>, it<WG1410> cannot<WG3756> defile<WG2840> him<WG846>;

because <WG3754> it goeth<WG1531> not<WG3756> into<WG1519> his<WG846> heart<WG2588>, but<WG235> into<WG1519> his belly<WG2836>, and<WG2532> goeth out<WG1607> into<WG1519> the draught<WG856>? This he said<WG2511>, making all<WG3956> meats clean<WG1033>.
And <WG1161> he said<WG3754>, That which proceedeth out<WG1607> of<WG1537> the man<WG444>, that<WG1565> defileth<WG2840> the man<WG444>.

For <WG1063> from within<WG2081>, out<WG1537> of the heart<WG2588> of men<WG444>, evil<WG2556> thoughts<WG1261> proceed<WG1607>, fornications<WG4202>, thefts<WG2829>, murders<WG5408>, adulteries<WG3430>,
covetings <WG4124>, wickednesses<WG4189>, deceit<WG1388>, lasciviousness<WG766>, an<WG3788> evil<WG4189> eye<WG3788>, railing<WG988>, pride<WG5243>, foolishness<WG877>:
all <WG3956> these<WG5023> evil things<WG4190> proceed<WG1607> from within<WG2081>, and<WG2532> defile<WG2840> the man<WG444>.

And <WG2532> from thence<WG1564> he arose<WG450>, and went<WG565> away into<WG1519> the borders<WG3181> of Tyre<WG5184> and<WG2532> Sidon<WG4605>. And<WG2532> he entered<WG1525> into<WG1519> a house<WG3614>, and would have<WG2309> no man<WG3762> know<WG1097> it<WG2532>; and he could<WG1410> not<WG3756> be hid<WG2990>.

But <WG1063> straightway a<WG1135> woman<WG1135>, whose<WG3739> little daughter<WG2365> had<WG2192> an<WG4151> unclean<WG169> spirit<WG4151>, having<WG2192> heard<WG191> of<WG4012> him<WG846>, came<WG2064> and fell<WG4363> down at<WG4314> his<WG846> feet<WG4228>.

Now the woman<WG1135> was<WG2258> a Greek<WG1674>, a Syrophoenician<WG4949> by race<WG1085>. And<WG2532> she besought<WG2065> him<WG846> that<WG2443> he would cast forth<WG1544> the demon<WG1140> out<WG1537> of<WG2364> her<WG846> daughter<WG2364>.

And <WG1161> he<WG2424> said<WG2036> unto her<WG846>, Let<WG863> the children<WG5043> first<WG4412> be filled<WG5526>: for<WG1063> it is<WG2076> not<WG3756> meet<WG2570> to take<WG2983> the children<WG5043>'s bread<WG740> and<WG2532> cast<WG906> it to the dogs<WG2952>.

But <WG1161> she answered<WG611> and<WG2532> saith<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, Yea<WG3483>, Lord<WG2532>; even<WG1063> the dogs<WG2952> under<WG5270> the table<WG5132> eat<WG2068> of<WG575> the children<WG3813>'s crumbs<WG5589>.
And <WG2532> he said<WG2036> unto her<WG846>, For<WG1223> this<WG5126> saying<WG3056> go thy way<WG5217>; the demon<WG1140> is gone out<WG1831> of<WG1537> thy<WG4675> daughter<WG2364>.
And <WG2532> she went<WG565> away unto<WG1519> her<WG846> house<WG3624>, and<WG2532> found<WG2147> the child laid<WG906> upon<WG1909> the bed<WG2825>, and<WG2532> the demon<WG1140> gone out<WG1831>.

And <WG2532> again<WG3825> he went<WG1831> out from<WG1537> the borders<WG3725> of Tyre<WG5184>, and<WG2532> came<WG2064> through Sidon<WG4605> unto<WG4314> the sea<WG2281> of Galilee<WG1056>, through<WG303> the midst<WG3319> of the borders<WG3725> of Decapolis<WG1179>.

And <WG2532> they bring<WG5342> unto him<WG846> one that was deaf<WG2974>, and had an impediment in his speech<WG3424>; and<WG2532> they beseech<WG3870> him<WG846> to<WG2443> lay<WG2007> his hand<WG5495> upon<WG2007> him<WG846>.

And <WG2532> he took<WG618> him<WG846> aside2596, 2398 from<WG575> the multitude<WG3793> privately<WG906>, and put his<WG846> fingers<WG1147> into<WG1519> his<WG846> ears<WG3775>, and<WG2532> he spat<WG4429>, and touched<WG680> his<WG846> tongue<WG1100>;
and <WG2532> looking up<WG308> to<WG1519> heaven<WG3772>, he sighed<WG4727>, and<WG2532> saith<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, Ephphatha<WG2188>, that<WG3739> is<WG2076>, Be opened<WG1272>.
And2532, 2112 his<WG846> ears<WG189> were opened<WG1272>, and<WG2532> the bond<WG1199> of<WG1100> his<WG846> tongue<WG1100> was loosed<WG3089>, and<WG2532> he spake<WG2980> plain<WG3723>.

And <WG2532> he charged<WG1291> them<WG846> that<WG2443> they should tell<WG2036> no man<WG3367>: but<WG1161> the more<WG3745> he<WG846> charged<WG1291> them<WG846>, so much the more<WG3123> a great deal<WG4054> they published it<WG2784>.

And <WG2532> they were<WG1605> beyond measure<WG5249> astonished<WG1605>, saying<WG3004>, He hath done<WG4160> all things<WG3956> well<WG2573>; he maketh<WG4160> even<WG2532> the deaf<WG2974> to hear<WG191>, and<WG2532> the dumb<WG216> to speak<WG2980>.
